intro: Zwingera quassioides, commonly known as the quassioid zwingera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a slightly serrated edge. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
